Document Sources.Sourced Statement: about 96% of residents are Black, and about 91% of homes were built prior to 1978, according to the U.S. Census Bureau.
Document Sources.Source Justification: used as a credible source for demographic and housing data

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: To find out if your individual home was built before 1978, check Realtor.com or the Shelby County Assessor of Property website.
Document Sources.Name of Source: Realtor.com; Shelby County Assessor of Property website
Document Sources.Source Justification: provided as resources for readers to verify their home's construction year

Named Person Sources.Source Justification: author of the article, providing context and expertise on housing and development

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: call the Shelby County Health Department at 901-222-9582 or email them at sch.clppp@shelbycountytn.gov.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: recommended as a resource for readers to schedule free lead testing

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: call the Shelby County Lead Hazard Control program at 901-222-7605 or the City of Memphis Lead-Safe program at 901-636-5323.
Named Organization Sources.Name of Source: Shelby County Lead Hazard Control program; City of Memphis Lead-Safe program
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: provided as resources for readers to have their homes tested for lead
publisher of the article, focused on poverty, power, and policy in Memphis
